question: 一文字
sourceMnemonic: When you have <kanji>one</kanji> <kanji>writing</kanji> <kanji>letter</kanji> what do you have? Here's a hint, there's one kanji in this word that consists of one writing letter (aka a <vocabulary>straight line</vocabulary>).
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>文</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

<vocabulary>Straight line</vocabulary>s are for <reading>mon</reading>sters (<ja>もん</ja>). Only a monster would ever draw a perfectly straight line. You're no monster, so no straight lines for you!
